rComments: Kehler is definitely one of the best professors in the department. He's is VERY knowledgeable, a great lecturer, and generally a cool guy. The classroom environment always feels relaxed and he makes the lectures entertaining. There is lots of reading, and you don't want to miss class for the sake of missing out on LOTS of information.

He's a very unique kind of person I really loved him. He makes the class interesting and actually talks about different topics. I was never bored in class, we were always discussing and debating different topics. Also does his best to make it a safe space. He's very intellectual and encourages his students to think and analyze def a cool professor
Although I no longer attend UC Santa Cruz, Dr. Kehler was an excellent teacher. The course requires a lot of reading but  he is very articulate when it comes to explaining the subject matter.

Honestly a very nice professor. 4 simple essays and he is very detailed in his editing and will tell you exactly what he expects. Hes a fair grader and will give you opportunity to experiment with your writing for the final paper. No bs road maps or stupid assignments. Hes a practical dude and I loved him.

I thoroughly enjoyed both classes I took with Doctor Kehler. A great sense of humor and class style that makes for a relaxed and comfortable environment.The class being centered around a history lecture and film, I felt like we were all part of a cool history club (Hist majors know). Anyways, a fantastic professor to have that I hope to know better

What a fantastic professor! I took two classes from him (History of Germany Through Film from 1919-1945,1945-present) and he was a blessing to have! Very silly and often times subtle dark sense of humor, his class was an hour lecture followed by a feature film, in which he would give us great context to watch each film with. My favorite professor!

Incredibly positive, will do anything he can to help his students. He's a wonderful professor, gave excellent feedback on writings and never gave us useless work, mostly just 4 papers which he grades in a timely manner. No silly "roadmaps." Take him if you get the opportunity, best core professor!!

Great professor! Every lecture is dialed down to the second which gives him time to be precise and emphasise specific points. Highly recommend. My class had two 8 page essays. No BS history bluebook exams.

He did a really fantastic job at  teaching the material and I valued the time I had with him in class. If you want a professor who is witty, knowledgeable and very thorough then hes the professor for you.

Dr. Kehler has been one of the most kind and helpful mentors at UCSC since my first class with him as a freshman. He is extremely knowledgeable and has a gift and a passion for teaching. He demands a lot but I have never regretted taking any of his classes. Do yourself the favor of taking his classes and having a chat with him. Kehler - you rock.

Professor Kehler was always clear and to the point in core seminars. I looked forward to attending his classes. He made sure that we understood the content and was helpful in generating ideas for essays. In my opinion he is a fair grader; I had no problem getting an A.
Lectures were interesting. Throws in comical relief often, which helps with the sometimes dry material. Great sense of humor and very knowledgeable. His slide shows rock!

Edward Kehler all around is a great proffesor to have. He guides classroom conversation perfectly, smart, never overly opiniated, and really wants to make you a better writer. He's kind of a grammer fanatic, but nothing too extreme. He also has a very random weird sense of humor that is hit or miss with most people.

Dr. Kehler is a really smart guy and a great discussion leader. He lets the students talk and plays the perfect Devil's advocate to spur the debate. He is a fair grader and his comments on essays are very helpful.
I love Edward! Edward is probably the most strange yet interesting professor I have ever had. Definitely worth taking. I had a GREAT time in his class.
